title: easyMoney faces overhaul as savers complain 'we don't know where our cash is invested'
text:
Peer-to-peer website easyMoney is to overhaul its platform amid criticism of its levels of disclosure and concerns that it puts its customers' money at greater risk than they realise.

Telegraph Money has been contacted by one customer who complained that he had no idea where his cash had been invested. One industry expert said that easyMoney has “among the worst levels of disclosure” in the sector.

The platform carries the “easy” brand made famous by Sir Stelios Haji-Ioannou’s budget airline easyJet and offers returns of up to 7.28pc on a £10,000 investment in property projects.

Customers are currently given a unique reference number and repayment date but no information about the property...
